title: Sustainable Logistics: Navigating the Path of a Green Supply Chain - Supply and Demand Chain Executive
summary: The article discusses the emergence of green supply chain practices focusing on sustainability, EVs integration, circular economy principles, and the benefits of implementing a green supply chain.
green_innovation: TRUE. The article highlights the adoption of green supply chain practices and technologies to minimize environmental impacts in the supply chain process, thus aligning with green innovation principles.
business_innovation: FALSE. The article focuses on sustainability practices within the supply chain and does not primarily discuss the introduction of new or significantly improved products or business processes.
green_product: TRUE. The article discusses the adoption of eco-friendly alternatives and sustainable practices in product design, manufacturing, and usage, aligning with the definition of a green product.
green_process: TRUE. The article emphasizes the implementation of methods and techniques to minimize environmental impacts, reduce waste, conserve resources, and promote sustainability in operational activities, indicating a green process innovation.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 335932 - Noncurrent-Carrying Wiring Device Manufacturing, 484210 - Used Household and Office Goods Moving, 484110 - General Freight Trucking, Local, 522130 - Credit Unions (Financial Cooperatives)
greenwashing: FALSE. The article does not exhibit characteristics of greenwashing but rather emphasizes genuine efforts towards implementing sustainable and environmentally friendly practices within the supply chain.

title: Bio-Composite Materials Market Forecasted to Expand Dramatically with a Robust CAGR of 17.03% between 2023 and ... - GlobeNewswire
summary: The article discusses the growth of the bio-composite materials market, driven by environmental consciousness and sustainability adoption across industries. It projects a significant market expansion from $11.90 billion in 2022 to $55.93 billion by 2032, fueled by the demand for eco-friendly alternatives.
green_innovation: TRUE. The article discusses the adoption of sustainable and biodegradable materials across industries leading to reduced environmental impact and enhanced sustainability, aligning with green innovation.
business_innovation: FALSE. The focus of the article is on the growth and adoption of bio-composite materials in the market, emphasizing their environmental benefits rather than a distinct business process or product innovation.
green_product: TRUE. The article emphasizes the use of bio-composite materials designed to reduce environmental impact throughout their life cycle, incorporating sustainable production processes and eco-friendly functionalities.
green_process: TRUE. The article highlights the use of manufacturing methods that aim to minimize environmental impacts, promote sustainability, reduce waste, and limit the release of harmful substances into the environment, aligning with green process principles.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 326140 - Polystyrene Foam Product Manufacturing, 325998 - All Other Miscellaneous Chemical Product and Preparation Manufacturing, 325211 - Plastics Material and Resin Manufacturing, 423390 - Other Construction Material Merchant Wholesalers
greenwashing: FALSE. The article focuses on the positive environmental attributes of bio-composite materials and their market growth, without making false or misleading claims, thus not falling under greenwashing.
